cyclone.name: IDALIA
cyclone.current_location: about 30 mi SSE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to meander near the Yucatan Channel today, then accelerate north-northeast across the eastern Gulf of Mexico, reaching the Florida Big Bend as a hurricane Tuesday night/early Wednesday, and thereafter sweep northeast across Georgia and the Carolinas, emerging near or just south of coastal Virginia late Thursday into Friday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (near Cedar Key–Apalachicola area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: No U.S. watches posted yet; current watches limited to the Isle of Youth, Cuba.
weather_observation.warning_coast: No U.S. warnings posted yet; present warnings limited to portions of the Yucatan Peninsula and Pinar del Rio, Cuba.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: West coast of Florida, Florida Panhandle, southern Georgia, Carolinas, and potentially southeast Virginia late in the 5-day period.
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤3%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; breezy conditions likely late Thursday–Friday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for Hampton Roads; only minor tidal departures possible if the center passes close to the coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain possible late Thursday into Friday, with localized higher amounts under heavier bands.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and long-period swells beginning late week could disrupt vessel scheduling and cargo handling.
